body_html:
Please provide a full reproducible example. For example, I tried the following on both TensorFlow 0.11.0 and 1.0.1 and was unable to see a problem. It would greatly help if you can provide the failure.

import tensorflow as tf

# Create a model and save it
x = tf.Variable(1)
with tf.Session() as sess:
  sess.run(tf.initialize_all_variables()) # tf.global_variables_initializer() in 1.0
  saver = tf.train.Saver()
  saver.save(sess, '/tmp/model')

# Restore in another session
with tf.Session() as sess:
  saver = tf.train.Saver()
  saver.restore(sess, '/tmp/model')

body:
Please provide a full reproducible example. For example, I tried the following on both TensorFlow 0.11.0 and 1.0.1 and was unable to see a problem. It would greatly help if you can provide the failure.

```python
import tensorflow as tf

# Create a model and save it
x = tf.Variable(1)
with tf.Session() as sess:
  sess.run(tf.initialize_all_variables()) # tf.global_variables_initializer() in 1.0
  saver = tf.train.Saver()
  saver.save(sess, '/tmp/model')

# Restore in another session
with tf.Session() as sess:
  saver = tf.train.Saver()
  saver.restore(sess, '/tmp/model')
```
